profile_positions.title: Vice President - Global Sustainability Policy & Partnerships

profile_positions.description:
Already serving in Corporate Communications at the company's headquarters in Chicago, this expanded role adds a range of additional responsibilities and grows the team to ~70 employees. The Global Brand & Corporate Communications group strengthens the company’s brand and reputation and drives business results by developing strategies, narratives and programs on key enterprise themes such as aerospace safety, sustainability, operational excellence and financial performance. The team defines Boeing’s brand platform and drives messaging discipline through a more unified company narrative. This team also leads global employee engagement and leadership communications, developing employee-centric communications programs for Boeing’s global workforce and leaders. In addition to leading crisis and issues management, the group frames and advances functional excellence initiatives for the Communications function at Boeing.

Select Achievements:

- Oversaw comms for Boeing’s Confident Travel Initiative (CTI), improving confidence level during COVID by >10% in 3 months
- Reformed reputation and sentiment research to lay the foundation for revitalized brand platform (Trust index +7% Elites; +5% GenPop)
- Launched company’s first-ever Chief Sustainability Officer role and related ESG communications framework
profile_positions.title: Vice President - Global Brand & Corporate Communications

profile_positions.description:
Moved to Corporate HQ to lead communications for the CFO and Executive Vice President for Enterprise Performance and Strategy. Responsibilities included overseeing financial communications for the company, coordinating communications for Boeing’s M&A activities and for its venture capital arm ‘HorizonX’, and promoting the company’s overarching operational performance as well as its Environment, Social, and Governance (ESG) activities. Brian reported to both the SVP of Communications for Boeing as well as the CFO and Executive Vice President for Enterprise Performance and Strategy. Brian served on both of those leadership teams.

Select Achievements:

- Defined company’s overarching strategic narrative on its financial health as well as its technology, innovation and safety posture
- Prepared quarterly earnings messaging in partnership with Investor Relations (including largest corporate debt raise)
- Framed the firm’s largest business transformation in response to the global COVID pandemic, involving workforce actions and portfolio, infrastructure, and supply chain adjustments
profile_positions.title: Vice President - Communications (Finance I Enterprise Performance I Strategy)

profile_positions.description:
Served as Boeing’s primary point of contact on political issues, campaigns and regulatory stakeholder engagements in Europe, positioning the company’s perspective with senior EU and NATO stakeholders. Developed an integrated government affairs strategy at pan-European level and lead a team of government affairs professionals (in London, Paris, Berlin, Rome, Amsterdam, Warsaw and Brussels) who advanced the company’s policy objectives in the region. Focus areas included aviation safety & security, future mobility, workforce development, chemical regulations, transatlantic trade & defense cooperation, sustainability, as well as aerospace research & development. He also expanded the company’s engagements with NATO, successfully positioning Boeing for several large-scale defense and services contracts.

Select Achievements:

- Scaled and led team in 7 pan-European offices that contributed to accelerated business growth and helped double Boeing’s presence on the continent in < 5 years  
- Tracked emerging issues and developed strategies to get ahead of and de-risk potential future policy issues (e.g. protected double-digit million € product development investments by shaping European chemical regulations)
- Successfully built direct engagements with four EU Commissioners (Transport, Digital, Industry, and Competition)
- As head of Boeing’s relationship with NATO, shaped Alliance policies on transatlantic-defense cooperation and championed sales of various Boeing defense products and services worth more than $1B
- Launched ‘Boeing in Europe’ campaign to convey Boeing’s positive economic and social impact on the region, collaborating across organization boundaries and positioning Boeing as a STEM education catalyst (e.g. created first Coding Summer School in Brussels, starting in 2016) 
- Represented aerospace industry at ‘COP21’ Paris climate change conference to outline sectoral progress and future ambitions
profile_positions.title: Vice President, Government Affairs, Europe

profile_positions.description:
Directed Boeing business activities across 13 countries, including the Nordics, Baltics, BeNeLux, Austria and Switzerland, tasked to expand government and industry relationships to improve access, enhance company reputation, and ensure compliance with local and national laws.

Select Achievements:

- Established company relations with broad range of regional customers and suppliers in support of sales campaigns
- Re-built a cross-functional business services team of 60+ employees in the Netherlands 
- Initiated more than a dozen public-private partnerships in support of Boeing’s major strategy pillars (e.g. on sourcing, formation of Danish Advanced Manufacturing Research Center (DAMRC), now featuring >100 member companies)
- Navigated complex regulatory environment to advance the use of sustainable fuels in aviation with key customers
profile_positions.title: Director - Boeing International, Northern Europe

profile_positions.description: Recruited by Commercial Airplane CEO to build and lead the team responsible for defining the narrative for Boeing’s largest business unit. Engaged media on BCA product & services strategy, environmental & aviation policy, and the group’s global market outlook. Communicated strategic partnership with various global supply chain and industrial partners. Led the campaign to apply for and win the ‘Collier Trophy’ for the 787 Dreamliner – the highest honor in aerospace.
profile_positions.title: Director - Communications, Boeing Commercial Airplanes

profile_positions.description: Led a cross-functional team to deliver more than $1B in industrial commitments to the UK, Nordics, and Switzerland. Collaborated with Boeing Research & Technology to locate and leverage industrial capability and third-party investments. Oversaw and leveraged $12M budget to create a more integrated Boeing presence in European focus countries. Served is primary liaison for industrial partnerships in Denmark.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager – Industrial Participation & Alliances

profile_positions.location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
profile_positions.description: Served two separate terms, first as Chief of Staff to the SVP of Sales and then, following a fellowship on Capitol Hill, to the CEO for Boeing’s $30B defense business. Teamed with broad range of external stakeholders and internal business leaders to seamlessly coordinate business, strategy and program reviews; manage the CEO’s formal written correspondence and plan Board presentations; and drive functional excellence for the Sales organization. Partnered with HR and Strategy to develop and deploy change agenda and strategic priorities 30,000+ FTE business unit.
profile_positions.title: Chief of Staff – President & CEO and Head of Sales – Boeing Defense, Space & Security (BDS)

profile_positions.location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
profile_positions.description: Granted sabbatical from Boeing after being selected as sole corporate fellow in cohort for a legislative fellowship on Capitol Hill. Successfully competed for placement with Congressman Shays (CT) benefiting from his bi-partisan approach to regulating and chairmanship of the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee. Advised the Congressman on a wide range of topics to include immigration reform, veterans affairs, and trade; and promoting the Member’s policy positions and track record with constituents, interest groups, and the media. Major accomplishment was co-authoring and promoting two bills which led to the Implementing Recommendations of the 9/11 Commission Act of 2007.
profile_positions.title: Brookings Institution Legislative Fellow – Office of the Hon. Christopher Shays, Congressman | CT
